alert.note: Alert for City of Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 2:58PM EST until November 11 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Gates County in northeastern North Carolina... The southwestern City of Suffolk in southeastern Virginia... * Until 330 PM EST. * At 258 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Gates, or 8 miles north of Gatesville, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Whaleyville around 310 PM EST. Holland around 320 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Drum Hill, Lummis, Somerton and Reynoldson. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
